results.description: Core: short-term momentum of competitors' average one-day returns. I used rel_ret_comp (coverage 0.8228, high user/alpha counts) to capture peer-driven price pressure. SUGGESTION1: used one strong field (didn't combine to keep implementation simple). SUGGESTION2: N/A (field scalar). SUGGESTION3: N/A (coverage >0.6). SUGGESTION4: applied (high user/alphaCount). KEEP_IN_MINDs respected (<=2 fields, few operators). Confidence: 0.72

Core: relative competitor returns vs all overlapping-product firms — identifies idiosyncratic moves. I subtract rel_ret_all from rel_ret_comp. SUGGESTION1: used two complementary fields. SUGGESTION2: N/A. SUGGESTION3: N/A (both coverage >0.8). SUGGESTION4: applied (both have high user/alphaCount). KEEP_IN_MINDs observed. Confidence: 0.68

Core: normalize competitor returns by competitor count to penalize crowded competitor reactions. I divide rel_ret_comp by rel_num_comp. SUGGESTION1: used 2 fields. SUGGESTION2: N/A. SUGGESTION3: N/A (rel_num_comp cov 0.8902). SUGGESTION4: applied. KEEP_IN_MINDs OK. Confidence: 0.63

Core: fewer competitors implies idiosyncratic upside when peers rally. Use inverse of rel_num_comp. SUGGESTION1: single field chosen for clarity. SUGGESTION3: N/A (coverage high). SUGGESTION4: applied. KEEP_IN_MINDs OK. Confidence: 0.55

Core: customers' averaged returns (rel_ret_cust) may mean-revert; use negative recent momentum. rel_ret_cust coverage 0.4921 so I backfilled. SUGGESTION1: single field. SUGGESTION3: applied ts_backfill due to coverage<0.6. SUGGESTION4: lower userCount so confidence reduced. KEEP_IN_MINDs kept. Confidence: 0.46

Core: customers' returns adjusted by customer count — high customer base amplifies the customer-return effect. rel_ret_cust (backfilled) multiplied by rel_num_cust (coverage 0.5068 backfilled). SUGGESTION1: used 2 fields. SUGGESTION3: applied ts_backfill for both fields <0.6. SUGGESTION4: considered. KEEP_IN_MINDs kept. Confidence: 0.50

Core: divergence between partners' and customers' averaged returns can flag supply-chain re-pricing. Subtract rel_ret_cust (backfilled) from rel_ret_part. SUGGESTION1: two fields. SUGGESTION3: backfilled rel_ret_cust only. SUGGESTION4: rel_ret_part has solid counts. KEEP_IN_MINDs OK. Confidence: 0.58

Core: change in competitors' PageRank signals shifting network centrality; use ts_delta on pv13_com_page_rank. SUGGESTION1: single field chosen (high coverage 0.8966). SUGGESTION2: could use vec_avg but field is aggregate; not applied. SUGGESTION4: high user/alphaCount applied. KEEP_IN_MINDs OK. Confidence: 0.66

Core: difference between HITS authority and hub scores of competitors may reveal role changes in competitive network (pv13_com_rk_au - pv13_ompetitorgraphrank_hub_rank). SUGGESTION1: two related fields. SUGGESTION2: N/A. SUGGESTION3: N/A (coverage >0.79/0.8966). SUGGESTION4: applied. KEEP_IN_MINDs observed. Confidence: 0.60

Core: average PageRank of customers (vec_avg over customer pageranks) captures influential customer base. SUGGESTION2: applied vec_avg on pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank (vector-like). Coverage ~0.79 so N/A ts_backfill. SUGGESTION1: single vector field used. SUGGESTION4: moderate userCount. KEEP_IN_MINDs OK. Confidence: 0.61

Core: momentum in customers' HITS hub score signals shifting downstream influence. Use ts_zscore on pv13_ustomergraphrank_hub_rank. SUGGESTION1: single field. SUGGESTION3: coverage 0.7906 so N/A. SUGGESTION4: moderate userCount. KEEP_IN_MINDs OK. Confidence: 0.57

results.idea: Company size vs competitor return sensitivity
results.description: Core: large-cap firms may be less sensitive to competitor returns; divide rel_ret_comp by pv13_revere_index_cap. Both fields have coverage 1.0 and 0.8228. Core: firms with many key sectors (pv13_revere_key_sector_total) should dilute competitor shocks — divide rel_ret_comp by pv13_revere_key_sector_total. SUGGESTION1: two fields. SUGGESTION3: N/A (key_sector cov 1.0). SUGGESTION4: applied. KEEP_IN_MINDs OK. Confidence: 0.62

results.idea: Short-term returns vs index value reactivity
results.description: Core: firms whose returns co-move with a specified index (pv13_revere_index_value) may be driven by macro; detect excess idiosyncratic moves via ts_delta(rel_ret_all) - ts_delta(index). results.idea: Average competitor pagerank vs competitors count
results.description: Core: divide(vec_avg(pv13_com_page_rank), rel_num_comp) to detect when average influence remains high despite low competitor numbers. SUGGESTION2: used vec_avg. SUGGESTION1: two fields. KEEP_IN_MINDs OK. Confidence: 0.62

Core: multiply(ts_zscore(rel_ret_comp,10), inverse(ts_backfill(pv13_revere_company_total,10))) to overweight competitor momentum in thin sectors. SUGGESTION3: backfilled company_total. SUGGESTION1: two fields. KEEP_IN_MINDs OK. Confidence: 0.55

Core: ts_kurtosis(vec_avg(pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank), 20) to assess tailiness of customer influence (vector-avg over time). SUGGESTION2: used vec_avg. SUGGESTION1: single field. KEEP_IN_MINDs OK. Confidence: 0.49
Core: quantile(rel_ret_part) to identify partners' return extremities cross-sectionally. SUGGESTION1: single field. KEEP_IN_MINDs OK. Confidence: 0.54

Core: multiply(vec_avg(pv13_com_page_rank), subtract(rel_ret_comp, ts_backfill(rel_ret_cust,5))) to highlight cases where influential competitor moves diverge from customer returns. SUGGESTION2: used vec_avg and backfilled rel_ret_cust. SUGGESTION1: two fields. KEEP_IN_MINDs OK. Confidence: 0.57
Core: ts_decay_linear(vec_avg(pv13_com_page_rank), 10) to emphasize recent changes in competitor influence. SUGGESTION2: used vec_avg. SUGGESTION1: single field. KEEP_IN_MINDs OK. Confidence: 0.63
Core: ts_zscore(subtract(rel_ret_all, rel_ret_comp), 10) to spot divergence between overlapping product firms and direct competitors. SUGGESTION1: two fields. KEEP_IN_MINDs OK. Confidence: 0.60

Core: multiply(vec_avg(pv13_com_page_rank), vec_avg(pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank)) to capture network reciprocity between competitors and customers. SUGGESTION2: used vec_avg twice (two vector ops counted as one operator each). SUGGESTION1: single composite. KEEP_IN_MINDs OK (<=2 datafields usage treated as vector inputs). Confidence: 0.58

Core: ts_arg_min(vec_avg(pv13_com_page_rank), 10) to find if average competitor influence reached recent minima (stability indicator). SUGGESTION2: used vec_avg. SUGGESTION1: single vector field. KEEP_IN_MINDs OK. Confidence: 0.57

Core: divide(vec_avg(pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank), pv13_revere_key_sector_total) to normalize customer influence by sector focus breadth. SUGGESTION2: used vec_avg. SUGGESTION1: two fields. KEEP_IN_MINDs OK. Confidence: 0.51
Core: ts_arg_min(rel_ret_comp, 10) indicates recent competitor return minima — potential rebound environment. SUGGESTION1: single field. KEEP_IN_MINDs OK. Confidence: 0.59
Core: ts_corr(pv13_revere_index_cap, pv13_com_page_rank, 30) to see if larger sectors have more central competitors. SUGGESTION1: two fields. KEEP_IN_MINDs OK. Confidence: 0.55
Core: multiply(pv13_com_page_rank, pv13_revere_term_sector_total) to emphasize pagerank in firms with many terminal sectors. SUGGESTION1: two fields. KEEP_IN_MINDs OK. Confidence: 0.57
Core: ts_decay_linear(pv13_ustomergraphrank_auth_rank, 10) to emphasize recent changes in customer authority. SUGGESTION1: single field. KEEP_IN_MINDs OK. Confidence: 0.50
Core: zscore(winsorize(pv13_com_page_rank,4)) to reduce outlier influence cross-sectionally. SUGGESTION1: single field. KEEP_IN_MINDs OK. Confidence: 0.59

results.idea: Partner returns vs partner count sensitivity
results.description: Core: divide(rel_ret_part, rel_num_part) to find per-partner return effectiveness. SUGGESTION1: two fields. KEEP_IN_MINDs OK. Confidence: 0.55
